definition: male/Baron, lowest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Melva kisses another guy in front of her boyfriend justifying it to herself as an eye for an eye.
sentences.chinese: 梅尔瓦在男友面前亲吻另一个男孩，自以为报复。

sentences.english: I think we should let Sylvia go camping with her boy-friend.
sentences.chinese: 我认为我们应该让Sylvia和她男友一起去宿营。

sentences.english: Today, I went to my long-distance boyfriend's party.
sentences.chinese: 今天我去参加异地恋男友的聚会。

sentences.english: Your boyfriend should not be in charge of your clitoris.
sentences.chinese: 你男友不应该管你的阴蒂，它属于你。

sentences.english: And you're talking about your relationship with your boyfriend or girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 你们正在讨论自己跟男友或者女友的关系。

sentences.english: She's sobbing because her boyfriend broke up with her.
sentences.chinese: 她正抽抽噎噎地哭泣，因为男友和她分手了。

sentences.english: A girl took pictures of the flowers which got from her boyfriend .
sentences.chinese: 一个女孩照了几张关于他男友送给她的花的照片。

sentences.english: Honey, if ex-boyfriends were dollars…you'd be loaded by now.
sentences.chinese: 如果前任男友能当钱，如今就是富婆了。

sentences.english: If my boyfriend had a virgin complex, I’d absolutely find another guy.
sentences.chinese: 我的男友要是有处女情结，我绝对会蹬了他再找一个。

sentences.english: The "girlfriend startled has stayed, is looking boyfriend's back, felt extremely despairs."
sentences.chinese: 女友惊呆了，望着男友的背影，感到非常绝望。

sentences.english: I bumped into my ex-boyfriend the other day in the street.
sentences.chinese: 我前几天在街上撞见了我的前男友。

sentences.english: Let's say your colleague at work has just been broken up with, by her boyfriend.
sentences.chinese: 假设你有个公司的同事刚刚和她的男友分手。

sentences.english: It became known to all that she had a boyfriend who was ready to sacrifice everything for her.
sentences.chinese: 所有的人都知道她有一个为她甘愿付出的男友。

sentences.english: My boyfriend and I just LOVE this aloe vera gel.
sentences.chinese: 男友和我都很爱这款芦荟胶。
一位前男友有着不可思议的手指。

sentences.english: Mary grinned at her boyfriend the moment she saw him.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽一看到男友就对他眉开眼笑起来。

definition: (coll.) (a woman's) close female friend/bestie/(originally written 閨密|闺密, an abbr. for 閨中密友|闺中密友)
to part company/to split up/to break up
